instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting battery
threads.message:
The macbook came with no data Acess on both type-c port. But it’s charging. 
I changed both <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>, one of the port is not working if I turn the type c upside down and the macbook is not detecting battery anymore , if I remover the charger cable the screen will go off, no battery logo at the top right of the screen.pls help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting battery
threads.message:
Is a bit difficult to understand you.
Please, find a better manner to explain; try another translation method.

So one port works correctly (both directions) and the other one works only in one direction?
Compare diode mode readings for CC1/2 lines between both ports.

Machine doesn't turn on with battery alone?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting battery
threads.message:
one port charge correctly both direction, and the other one works only in one direction yes.
the cc1/cc2 lines has same diode reading 587.
And machine doesn’t turn on with battery alone. If I power it with charger it comes one but when I remove the charger it goes off. And no Battry logo on the screen too.
<DIODE>D3328</DIODE> <SIGNAL>USB_XA_USB_BOT_N</SIGNAL> is ripped off 
<DIODE>D3354</DIODE> <SIGNAL>USB_XA_USB_BOT_P</SIGNAL> is ripped off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not detecting battery
threads.message:
<DIODE>D3354</DIODE> is connected to <SIGNAL>USBC_XB_USB_BOT_P</SIGNAL>.

You may have another damaged component, or broken trace; check under microscope.
Also remove USB-C ports and inspect their terminals.

Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> voltage with battery alone (no charger).
